title: Display players participating in the2019 Home Run Derby
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page
custom_steps: When the user views the page
custom_expected:
Then the user is able to see 8 tiles (2 columns of 4 each) of tiles
identifying the players participating in the 2019 HRD
   And the followin "2019 Home Run Derby; Presented by T-Mobile" title
   And, under the title, "Pick a perfect bracket and the predict the longest 
   HR (player and distance) to compete to win $250,000." text displays.

Note: Text may be updated to read differently

title: Tile Content
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page
custom_steps: When the user views the individual tiles
custom_expected:
Then the user is able to see:
   - Player Name
   - Player's team abbreviation (e.g. CHC)
   - Player Headshot
   - Player's seed #
   - Player stats (2019 season):
     - Home Runs (to date)
     - Longest HR
     - Top Exit Velocity

title: Display each player in the context of their HR Derby matchup in Round 1
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page
custom_steps: When the user views the individual matchups
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the correct match-ups for Round 1 of the 
2019 HRD

Note:  2018 Player data will be used in the Beta environment

title:
Display player information during the
pre-state of the 2019 HRD
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page, before the
2019 HRD begins
custom_steps: When the user views the individual tiles
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the correct content:
   - Player Name
   - Player's team abbreviation (e.g. CHC)
   - Player Headshot
   - Player's seed #
   - Player stats (2019 season):
   - Home Runs (to date)
   - Longest HR
   - Top Exit Velocity

title:
Display player information during the
live-state of the 2019 HRD
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page, during the live state
of the 2019 HRD
custom_steps: When the user views the individual tiles
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the correct content:
   - Player Name
   - Player's team abbreviation (e.g. CHC)
   - Player Headshot
   - Player's seed #
   - Player stats (2019 season):
   - Home Runs (to date)
   - Longest HR
   - Top Exit Velocity

title:
Display player information during the
post-state of the 2019 HRD
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page, after the
2019 HRD ends
custom_steps: When the user views the individual tiles
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the correct content:
   - Player Name
   - Player's team abbreviation (e.g. CHC)
   - Player Headshot
   - Player's seed #
   - Player stats (2019 season):
   - Home Runs (to date)
   - Longest HR
   - Top Exit Velocity

title:
Round 1 correct choice: Five (5) points 
for each correct Round 1 choice.
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has selected winning players in
Round 1
   And navigated to the "2019 Home Run Derby" page, 
   after Round 1 of the 2019 HRD ends
custom_steps: When the user views the correct choice tiles
custom_expected:
Then the user sees  Five (5) points 
for each correct Round 1 choice.

title:
Round 2 correct choice: Ten (10) points 
for each correct Round 2 choice
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has selected winning players in
Round 2
   And navigated to the "2019 Home Run Derby" page, 
   after Round 2 of the 2019 HRD ends
custom_steps: When the user views the correct choice tiles
custom_expected:
Then the user sees  Ten (10) points 
for each correct Round 2 choice.

title:
Champion correct choice: 
Fifteen (15) points for the correct champion
choice
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has selected winning players in
the final round
   And navigated to the "2019 Home Run Derby" page, 
   after the final round of the 2019 HRD ends
custom_steps: When the user views the correct choice tiles
custom_expected:
Then the user sees  Fifteen (15) points 
for the correct Champion choice

title: Perfect score is fifty-five (55) points
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has selected the correct finish in
all Three (3) rounds
   And navigated to the "2019 Home Run Derby" page, 
   after the final round of the 2019 HRD ends
custom_steps: When the user views the "Champion" tile
custom_expected: Then the user sees a perfect score of fifty-five (55)

title: In the event of a tie, users will be asked a series of tiebreaker questionsuntil the final Grand Prize winner is determined."
custom_preconds:
Given:  More than 1 user has completed the three 
(3) rounds with a perfect score
custom_steps: When the user navigates to the "Round 3" page
custom_expected:
Then the user sees an array of "Tiebreakers" questions
below the Round 3 tiles

title: Tiebreakers
custom_preconds:
Given:  More than 1 user has completed the three 
(3) rounds with a perfect score
And is on the "Round 3" page:  "Tiebreakers"
section
custom_steps:
When the user enters data in these tie breaker textboxes.

e.g.
   - What Will the Round 3 home run totals be for each finalist?
     (Each selected finalists name will autofill)
   - What is the longest home run hit in the 2019 T-Mobile Home
      Run Derby (as determined by MLB Statcast)?

Note: Tiebreaker questions are still TBD.
custom_expected: Then the user's entries selections are visible

title: App moves to "Round 2" after"Round 1" selection is made
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page, "Round 1" tab
custom_steps: When the user selects players in all 4 brackets
custom_expected: Then the page redirectes to the "Round 2" tab

title:
App moves to "Round 3" round after
"Round 2" selection is made
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user selected players in all 4 brackets
   And has been redirected to the "Round 2" tab
custom_steps: Whwn the user selects players in both brackets
custom_expected: Then the page redirectes to the "Round 3" tab

title:
Navigate between the rounds so user
can easily review or replace my selections
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page, during the live state
of the 2019 HRD and has completed his/her bracket
selections
custom_steps:
When the user clicks the "Round 1,"  "Round 2," or "Round 3"
links
custom_expected:
Then the user is able to see Magenta-color bars and Round titles that 
highlight the  round that is currently bring displayed

title:
Error messages when user is 
trying to advance to the Round 2 with an 
incomplete bracket
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page, during the live state
of the 2019 HRD and has partially completed 
his/her Round 1 bracket selections
custom_steps:
When the user attempts to advance to Round 2 with an 
incomplete bracket
custom_expected:
Then the user sees this error message when trying to advance to Round 2: 
"Please Select 1 Player From Each Bracket Before Continuing"

title:
Error messages when user is 
trying to advance to the Round 3 with an 
incomplete bracket
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page, during the live state
of the 2019 HRD and has partially completed 
his/her Round 2 bracket selections
custom_steps:
When the user attempts to advance to Round 3 (final round)
with an  incomplete bracket
custom_expected:
Then the user sees this error message when trying to advance to Round 3: 
"Please Pick the Winner of Both Semi Matchups Before Continuing"

title: Pre-State only features text
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page in pre-state--
before the HRD players have been announced
custom_steps: When the user views the "2019 Home Run Derby" page
custom_expected:
Then the page only displays text, 
   And all rounds are greyed out
   And the page shows this message:
   "PLAY THE 2019 T-MOBILE HOME RUN DERBY
    BRACKET CHALLENGE FOR
    A CHANCE TO WIN TICKETS TO GAME 1 OF THE
    2019 WORLD SERIES!
    The T-Mobile Home Run Derby Bracket Challenge is
    coming soon!  
    Check back after the players are announced to
    complete your bracket."

Note: Text is still TBD.

title:
Players are announced and voting
opens
custom_preconds:
Given:  the participants in the 2019 HRD have been
announced
custom_steps: When the players are announced on the MLB website
custom_expected:
Then the voting opens 
   And the users are able to make selections in all 3 Rounds
   And the the "Tiebreakers" textboxes  are enabled
   And the user information fields are enabled
   And the  checkbox adjoining  "I would like to receive commercial 
     e-mails from MLB.com and their partners" is enabled
   And the CAPTCHA tool is enabled
   And the "Submit" button is enabled

title: Player tile information
custom_preconds:
Given:  The HR Derby participants have been 
announced
   And the voting period begins
custom_steps: When the user is viewing a specific player's card
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the individual player's headshot
   And the player's name
   And the player's team initials (e.g. PHI for Philadelphia)
   And the player's seed position (1-8)
   And the player's Top Distance (e.g. 432 FT)
   And the player's Top Exit Velocity (e.g. 110.0 MPH)
   And a graphic circle (toward center of page) displaying the
     player's current number of home runs

title: Voting for 2019 HRD participants
custom_preconds:
Given:  The HR Derby participants have been 
announced
   And the voting period begins
custom_steps:
When the user selects one player from each of the 4 matchups 
      from Round 1
   And the user selects 2 players from the 2 matchups from Round 2
   And the user selects winning player from Round 3
   And the user enters text in the 3 tiebreaker questions
   And clicks the "Submit" button
custom_expected:
Then the "Thanks for playing..." page displays
   And the user's "Tiebreaker" answers are visible
   And they are visible under the tiles of the 2 HRD finalists

title: Thank you for voting for card
custom_preconds:
Given:  A user may only fill-out one bracket
   And the user has completed his/her bracket
   selections
   And sees a verification of his/her Tiebreaker 
   answers
custom_steps: When the user refreshes the page
custom_expected:
Then the "Thank you for voting for:" card displays
   And shows the player user selected to win the 2019 HRD
   And the 2019 HRD logo
   And "Thanks for playing..." text
   And these links:
     - Back to MLB
     - Sweeps Rules
   And a magenta-color button that reads:  "Change Pick"

title: Back to MLB ink on 'Thank You' card
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has completed his/her bracket
selections
   And is viewing the "Thank you for voting for..." 
   card
custom_steps: When the user clicks on the "Back to MLB" link
custom_expected: Then the user is returned to the MLB home page

title: Sweeps Rules ink on 'Thank You' card
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has completed his/her bracket
selections
   And is viewing the "Thank you for voting for..." 
   card
custom_steps: When the user clicks on the "Sweeps Rules" link
custom_expected:
Then a modal opens displaying the "T-Mobile Home Run Derby Challenge" 
rules

title: Change Pick
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has completed his/her bracket
selections
   And is viewing the "Thank you for voting for..." 
   card
custom_steps: When the user clicks the "Change Pick" button
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the first page of the "2019 Home Run 
Derby"

title: Page flips to "Locked' state
custom_preconds:
Given:  The user has navigated to the "2019 Home 
Run Derby" page
   And the page displays text encouraging users to
   tune in to the HR Derby:
   "Pick a perfect bracket and the predict the longest 
   HR (player and distance) to compete to win 
   $250,000"
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the page @ 8PM EDT on Monday, 
7.8.19
custom_expected:
Then the page transitions to this 'Contest Over' message:
"Thanks for playing the 2019 T-Mobile Home Run Derby
Bracket Challenge. Watch the 2019 T-Mobile Home Run
Derby on ESPN at 8 pm ET."

title: Page copy transitions to final text
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the "2019 Home 
Run Derby" page
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing the page after the conclusion of the
2019 HRD; (around 11 PM EDT on Monday, 7.8.19)
custom_expected:
Then the page transitions to this message:
"Thanks for playing the 2019 T-Mobile Home Run Derby
Bracket Challenge. Winner will be notified by July 19."

title:
Registration/Form
Entry
User data is entered
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page, during the live state
of the 2019 HRD and has completed his/her bracket
selections"
custom_steps:
When the user completes the "Tiebreaker" fields
   And enters text in these fields:
   - First/Last Names
   - Email address
   - Date of Birth
   - State/Province
   - Zip/Postal Code
   - Country of Origin
   - Favorite Team
   And clicks the "Submit" button
custom_expected:
Then the "Thanks for playing..." page displays
   And the user's data is acquired

title: Users under the age of 18 will be redirected to a COPPA page
custom_preconds: Given user enters a date of birth for 18 year old or under
custom_steps: When the user clicks submit, they will be given an error message. When trying to reload the ballot homepage
custom_expected: Then the user is directed to a COPPA page

title: Social media link icons display
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page
custom_steps: When the user clicks through the rounds

title: Facebook link icon function
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page
custom_steps:
When the user clicks through the rounds
   And clicks the Facebook icon link
custom_expected:
Then the "Share on Facebook" page opens 
   And shows this content:
   - A link back to the Bracket Challenge,
   - An image
   - Text: I got [winner] over [loser] in the 2019 T-Mobile Home Run Derby. 
      Fill out your bracket now.

title: Twitter link icon function
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby" page
custom_steps:
When the user clicks through the rounds
   And clicks the Twitter icon link
custom_expected:
Then the "Share a link with your follower" page opens 
   And shows this content:
   - A link back to the Bracket Challenge,
   - An image
   - Text: I got [winner] over [loser] in the 2019 T-Mobile Home Run Derby. 
      Fill out your bracket now.

title:
Full Width of 
Background Skins 
on the "2019 Home Run Derby" pages
(1680 pxl)"
custom_preconds: Given:  the user has opened a web browser
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to 
https://beta-aws.mlb.com/all-star/home-run-derby/bracket-challenge
custom_expected:
Then the correct sponsored ads are served:

1x1 background skins
728x90 leaderboard ad (300x50 in XS Mobile viewport)

title: Banner advertising displays
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has navigated to the  
"2019 Home Run Derby"" page"
custom_steps: When the user view the 2019 HRD page
custom_expected:
Then banner advertising displays at the top of the page
(paid advertising, not MLB ads)

title: HRD Bracket Challenge is SEO friendly
custom_preconds: Given: the user navigates to a web search engine
custom_steps: When the user searches for 'Home Run Derby Bracket Challenge'
custom_expected: Then the search engine (e.g. Google) renders all content/links through the Google Search Console.

title:
2019 HRD on the "At Bat" 
mobile app
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user has signed in to the "At Bat" mobile
app
custom_steps:
When the user scrolls right on "Top Stories"
   And taps the "2019 Home Run Derby" image
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the '2019 HRD ballot' screen
   And the header, footer and ads do not display
   And the user can vote without re entering their email address

title: Email confirmation of submission
custom_preconds:
Given: the user has completed his/her submission
   And the "Thank you for voting for:" card displays
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to his/her email inbox
   And opens the email with subject line:  
   "Your Home Run Derby Bracket Challenge submission"
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a confirmation of his/her 2019 HRD selections
   And "Tiebreaker"answers

title:
Email confirmation of "Change Pick"
resubmission
custom_preconds:
Given:  the user clicks the "Change Pick" button
on the "Thank you for voting for:" card
   And has modified his/her selections
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to his/her email inbox
   And opens a second email with subject line:  
   "Your Home Run Derby Bracket Challenge submission"
custom_expected:
Then the user sees a confirmation of his/her updated selections
   And "Tiebreaker"answers
